intro: Anemopaegma belizeanum, commonly known as the Belize anemopaegma, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Belize. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are ovate and have a velvety texture, while its stems are hairy and glandular.
